pack.name: ASCO GI 2026
pack.tagline: Pharma leaders presenting at the 2026 ASCO Gastrointestinal Cancers Symposium
pack.description: Decision-makers from pharma and biotech companies who presented clinical data, abstracts, or sponsored sessions at ASCO GI 2026 (January 23-25, San Francisco). These are companies actively investing in GI oncology with trials, approvals, or commercial launches imminent.
pack.targetBuyer: Oncology-focused AI/ML platforms, clinical trial software, medical writing services, RWE vendors targeting GI oncology

companies.abstractTitle: Phase 2 ILUSTRO trial of zolbetuximab plus mFOLFOX6 and nivolumab in CLDN18.2+ gastric cancer
companies.signalDetail: 8 abstracts at ASCO GI 2026 including late-breaking oral LBA284. Zolbetuximab is first-in-class CLDN18.2 mAb, ASP3082 is first KRAS G12D degrader. Heavy investment in precision oncology for GI cancers.

companies.abstractTitle: IMbrave150 long-term follow-up and new combination data in HCC
companies.signalDetail: Major presence at ASCO GI 2026 with Tecentriq combinations in HCC and CRC. Co-developed CLDN18.2 diagnostic with Astellas (Ventana assay). Active in biomarker-driven GI oncology.

people.name: Levi Garraway
people.title: Chief Medical Officer & Head of Global Product Development

companies.indication: Gastric cancer, MSI-H CRC, Esophageal cancer
companies.abstractTitle: KEYNOTE-859 and KEYNOTE-590 long-term survival data
companies.signalDetail: Dominant presence in GI oncology with KEYTRUDA. Multiple Phase 3 readouts in gastric, esophageal, and MSI-H colorectal cancer. Active biomarker programs for PD-L1 and MSI status.

people.name: Eric Rubin
people.title: SVP & Head of Early Oncology Development

people.name: Roy Baynes
people.title: SVP & Head of Global Clinical Development, CMO

companies.indication: Hepatocellular carcinoma, Gastric cancer, Esophageal cancer
companies.abstractTitle: CheckMate-649 5-year survival update in gastric/GEJ cancer
companies.signalDetail: Major IO player in GI oncology with CheckMate trials. OPDIVO + Yervoy combo in HCC and gastric cancer. Active in CTLA-4 + PD-1 combinations for refractory GI tumors.

companies.indication: Biliary tract cancer, Pancreatic cancer, Gastric cancer
companies.abstractTitle: TOPAZ-1 and POLO trial updates in biliary and pancreatic cancer
companies.signalDetail: Strong GI oncology portfolio with PARP inhibitor combinations. TOPAZ-1 in biliary tract cancer, POLO in BRCA+ pancreatic. Expanding to ADC combinations in GI tumors.

people.name: James Weatherall
people.title: VP, Data Science and AI, R&D

companies.indication: HER2+ Gastric cancer, HER2-low GI tumors
companies.abstractTitle: DESTINY-Gastric trials and HER2-low expansion data
companies.signalDetail: ADC leader in GI oncology. ENHERTU approved for HER2+ gastric cancer. Expanding to HER2-low tumors across GI tract. Pipeline includes DXd ADCs for CLDN18.2 and TROP2.

companies.indication: Gastric cancer, CRC, RET+ GI tumors
companies.abstractTitle: RAINBOW and REACH-2 long-term outcomes, RET fusion GI cancer data
companies.signalDetail: Established presence with Cyramza in gastric cancer. Expanding RET inhibitor Retevmo to GI tumors. Active in VEGF and targeted therapy combinations.

companies.abstractTitle: Trodelvy in advanced GI tumors: Phase 2 expansion data
companies.signalDetail: Expanding ADC platform to GI cancers. Trodelvy being evaluated in TROP2+ pancreatic, gastric, and colorectal cancers. Collaboration with Arcus for TIGIT combinations in GI.

companies.abstractTitle: CodeBreaK 300 Phase 3 data in KRAS G12C+ CRC
companies.signalDetail: First KRAS G12C inhibitor in CRC. CodeBreaK 300 showed significant PFS benefit. Competing with Mirati in KRAS space. Active combinations with cetuximab in CRC.

companies.abstractTitle: First-in-human data of INCB161734 in KRAS G12D-mutant PDAC
companies.signalDetail: Early clinical data on KRAS G12D inhibitor presented at ASCO GI 2026. Targeting ~40% of pancreatic cancers. Competing with Astellas ASP3082 and Revolution Medicines.

companies.abstractTitle: BEACON CRC 5-year survival and frontline combination data
companies.signalDetail: BRAFTOVI combo is standard of care in BRAF V600E CRC. Expanding to frontline setting. Active in ADC and bispecific development for GI cancers.

people.name: Ronald Goh
people.title: Director, AI & ML in Drug Discovery

companies.abstractTitle: Tukysa in HER2+ biliary and pancreatic cancers
companies.signalDetail: Tukysa expanding beyond breast to GI HER2+ tumors. Acquired by Pfizer in 2023. ADC expertise being applied across GI cancer targets.

companies.abstractTitle: RMC-6236 Phase 1/1b monotherapy and combination data in PDAC
companies.signalDetail: Novel RAS(ON) multi-selective inhibitor targeting KRAS G12X mutations. Strong early efficacy signals in pancreatic cancer. Competing for KRAS leadership with Amgen and Mirati.

companies.abstractTitle: RATIONALE 305/306 long-term data in gastric and esophageal cancer
companies.signalDetail: Strong GI oncology presence with tislelizumab. Global Phase 3 trials in gastric, esophageal, and liver cancers. Expanding to novel IO combinations.

companies.abstractTitle: COSMIC-312 and CELESTIAL long-term outcomes in HCC
companies.signalDetail: Cabometyx is backbone therapy in HCC. Active in combinations with IO agents. Pipeline includes next-gen TKIs and ADCs for GI oncology.

companies.abstractTitle: Novel combinations in GI malignancies
companies.signalDetail: Expanding oncology portfolio into GI tumors. ADC platform in development. Strong interest in biomarker-driven GI oncology approaches.

companies.abstractTitle: mRNA-4157 + pembrolizumab in MSS colorectal cancer
companies.signalDetail: Partnered with Merck on personalized cancer vaccines. Expanding KEYNOTE-942 platform to GI cancers. Novel approach to treat cold tumors.

companies.abstractTitle: NETTER-1 long-term data and radioligand therapy in GI-NETs
companies.signalDetail: Leader in radioligand therapy for GI neuroendocrine tumors. Lutathera approved for GI-NETs. Expanding radioligand platform to other GI targets.

companies.abstractTitle: Novel bispecific antibodies in solid tumors including GI
companies.signalDetail: Expanding oncology portfolio with bispecifics. Active in EGFR x MET and other dual-target approaches for GI tumors.

companies.abstractTitle: CEACAM5 ADC in gastric and colorectal cancers
companies.signalDetail: Novel CEACAM5-targeting ADC for GI tumors. CEA is highly expressed in GI cancers. Active development in gastric, CRC, and pancreatic cancers.

companies.abstractTitle: FRESCO-2 confirmatory data and real-world outcomes
companies.signalDetail: Fruquintinib approved for refractory mCRC in 2023. Active in combinations and earlier lines of therapy. Expanding GI oncology presence globally.

companies.abstractTitle: Individualized neoantigen therapy in pancreatic adenocarcinoma
companies.signalDetail: mRNA-based individualized cancer vaccines. Partnered with Genentech. PDAC vaccine showing immune responses in adjuvant setting.

companies.abstractTitle: Novel bispecific approaches in solid tumors
companies.signalDetail: Expanding Libtayo into GI cancers. Rich bispecific pipeline including MET x MET, EGFR x CD28. Active in combination trials for GI tumors.

companies.abstractTitle: Cell therapy approaches in GI diseases
companies.signalDetail: Expanding into GI beyond cystic fibrosis. Cell therapy platform being explored for GI inflammation and potentially GI cancers.

companies.abstractTitle: RNAi therapeutics for liver-based GI diseases
companies.signalDetail: Leader in RNAi therapeutics. Liver-targeted programs with GI implications. Expanding beyond rare disease into cardiometabolic with GI overlap.

companies.abstractTitle: IGF-1R targeting in GI diseases
companies.signalDetail: Acquired by Amgen. Pipeline includes potential GI applications of IGF-1R and other targets. Integration ongoing with Amgen R&D.

companies.abstractTitle: Xenotransplantation and manufactured organs
companies.signalDetail: Xenotransplant program for organ manufacturing. Potential applications in GI organ transplantation. Long-term vision for manufactured GI organs.

companies.abstractTitle: N/A
companies.signalDetail: Leading CRO with strong GI oncology trial expertise. Supporting multiple ASCO GI presenters. Active in Phase 2/3 GI cancer studies.

companies.abstractTitle: N/A
companies.signalDetail: Full-service biopharmaceutical solutions company. Strong oncology practice including GI cancers. Commercial and clinical trial support.

companies.abstractTitle: N/A
companies.signalDetail: Self-care company with GI portfolio. Partnerships with pharma on consumer health transitions. Interest in prescription-to-OTC switches.

companies.abstractTitle: Computational drug discovery for novel GI cancer targets
companies.signalDetail: Computational platform for drug discovery. Pipeline includes programs for GI cancer targets. Active partnerships with pharma on GI oncology.

companies.abstractTitle: TIGIT and adenosine pathway inhibitors in GI tumors
companies.signalDetail: Novel IO agents targeting TIGIT and adenosine pathways. Partnered with Gilead. Active in CRC, pancreatic, and gastric cancer trials.

companies.abstractTitle: Gene therapy approaches for liver diseases
companies.signalDetail: Gene therapy company with liver-directed platform. Potential applications in hereditary GI/hepatic conditions. Active in metabolic liver diseases.

companies.abstractTitle: Gene therapy for diseases with GI manifestations
companies.signalDetail: Gene therapy leader with potential GI applications. Duchenne patients often have GI symptoms. Platform expandable to other GI-impacting conditions.

companies.indication: Lysosomal storage disorders with GI symptoms
companies.abstractTitle: ERTs for conditions with GI manifestations
companies.signalDetail: Rare disease company with multiple programs having GI involvement. Lysosomal storage disorders often present with GI symptoms. Active in gene therapy.

companies.abstractTitle: Bispecific antibodies in solid tumors including GI
companies.signalDetail: Bispecific antibody platform company. XmAb technology being applied to GI cancer targets. Partnerships with major pharma for GI oncology.

companies.abstractTitle: Managing GI symptoms in neurological conditions
companies.signalDetail: CNS-focused company with GI symptom management component. Rett syndrome patients have significant GI involvement. Expanding into related indications.

companies.abstractTitle: Adjuvanted cancer vaccines for GI tumors
companies.signalDetail: Vaccine platform being explored for cancer applications. Matrix-M adjuvant technology. Early interest in GI cancer vaccine combinations.

companies.abstractTitle: ASO therapies for liver-based diseases
companies.signalDetail: Leader in antisense technology. Multiple liver-directed programs with GI implications. APOC3 and other targets affecting GI/metabolic function.

companies.abstractTitle: Managing GI complications in oncology
companies.signalDetail: Defitelio for hepatic VOD post-transplant. Interest in GI GVHD management. Oncology portfolio with GI toxicity management angle.

companies.abstractTitle: Neurological approaches to GI motility
companies.signalDetail: CNS company with interest in gut-brain axis. GI motility disorders have neurological components. Potential for CNS-GI crossover programs.

companies.abstractTitle: Allogeneic cell therapy approaches in solid tumors
companies.signalDetail: Gene editing company with cell therapy platform. Exploring allogeneic approaches for solid tumors including GI cancers. Partnership with Vertex on regenerative medicine.

companies.abstractTitle: In vivo gene editing for hereditary conditions
companies.signalDetail: Gene editing company with CRISPR platform. Exploring liver-directed editing with potential GI applications. Hereditary conditions with GI symptoms.

companies.abstractTitle: Precision base editing for genetic diseases
companies.signalDetail: Base editing platform for precise genetic correction. Multiple programs with potential GI applications. Liver-directed base editing technology.

companies.abstractTitle: Gene therapy outcomes including GI manifestations
companies.signalDetail: Gene therapy company for severe genetic diseases. Sickle cell and beta-thalassemia have GI/hepatic iron overload. Managing GI complications of transfusion-dependent patients.

companies.abstractTitle: In vivo CRISPR for liver-derived diseases
companies.signalDetail: In vivo CRISPR leader with liver-directed editing. ATTR amyloidosis has GI involvement. Platform applicable to other liver-derived GI conditions.

companies.indication: Lysosomal storage disorders with GI symptoms
companies.abstractTitle: Enzyme therapies for conditions with GI manifestations
companies.signalDetail: Rare disease company focused on lysosomal storage disorders. Fabry disease has significant GI involvement. Pompe disease affects GI function.

companies.abstractTitle: Complement inhibition in systemic diseases
companies.signalDetail: Complement inhibition platform. Potential applications in GI inflammation and complement-mediated GI conditions. Active in aHUS which has GI involvement.

companies.abstractTitle: FcRn antagonism in autoimmune diseases
companies.signalDetail: FcRn inhibitor platform for autoimmune diseases. Potential applications in autoimmune GI conditions like autoimmune gastritis. Partnered with Roivant.

companies.abstractTitle: S1P modulation in inflammatory bowel disease
companies.signalDetail: Acquired by Pfizer for etrasimod. Leading oral therapy for UC and Crohn's. Major presence in GI inflammation space. Real-world data presented.

companies.abstractTitle: Gene therapy for neuromuscular diseases with GI symptoms
companies.signalDetail: Rare disease gene therapy company. Multiple conditions treated have GI manifestations. Expanding platform into new GI-impacting indications.

companies.abstractTitle: Respiratory therapies and GI comorbidities
companies.signalDetail: Respiratory-focused company. COPD patients often have GERD as comorbidity. Interest in managing respiratory-GI overlap conditions.
